text: So one key difference between active inference and a lot of reward centric frameworks is that in contrast to thinking that the maximization of reward is the imperative for action, we frame the reduction of uncertainty as the imperative for action.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: So we can update our models, that's learning, or we can act to reduce our uncertainty.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And that's what motivates behavior.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And it has that pragmatic component, which is like utility or reward, but it's not just simply reinforcement or reward learning.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: So we can connect that to what you were saying.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: There is so much uncertainty in the world.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: There's things we just simply don't know about.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: We don't know we don't know about.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And now that recently we have been able to have our sphere of awareness expand to the global or even the intergalactic scale,
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: that breeds uncertainty of action.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And so there is that overlap between our sphere of influence and our sphere of action.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And we can think about how can we reduce uncertainty if only to reduce our anxiety or anxiety
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: feelings of negative valence, but actually to be more effective as well locally in our local situation.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: We can reduce our uncertainty about the volatility of the housing conditions locally.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And then also that aligns us with just other people who we then actually in a bottom-up way start to be able to do more and more.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: People start connecting, bringing their perspectives and skills together.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: the awareness and the capacity for action is increasing because you entered at the level of individual agency.
speaker: SPEAKER_02
